title: Christmas in August Poker Run It's a Toys for Tots charity ride happening here in Sandpoint at The Sandpoint Lions Club, 609 S. Ella St. on Saturday, August 9. All rides and rods are welcome to participate in this event. Starting time is at the Lions Club
description: Christmas in August Poker Run It's a Toys for Tots charity ride happening here in Sandpoint at The Sandpoint Lions Club, 609 S. Ella St. on Saturday, August 9. All rides and rods are welcome to participate in this event. Starting time is at the Lions Club at 9:00 a.m. and kick stands up at 10:30 a.m. The route will take you from the Sandpoint Lions Club, to the Moose Knuckle in Coolin for a break, then a scenic ride around Priest Lake, and back to the Lions Club for Dinner. After the ride, stick around for a live and silent auction, 50/50 raffle, a refreshing beer garden, and a $15 BBQ dinner. Cost is . RSVP or get more info by calling 208-661-0428. Check out the Facebook event here

title: POAC Annual Arts and Crafts Fair Pend Oreille Arts Council's Annual Arts and Crafts Fair
description: POAC Annual Arts and Crafts Fair Pend Oreille Arts Council's Annual Arts and Crafts Fair takes place in downtown Sandpoint on Saturday & Sunday, August 9-10, and features artist booths, food vendors, and a youth art arena. This two-day event occurs during one of the year's busiest weekends in Sandpoint. Last year's fair saw an attendance of over 5,000 visitors. The Arts & Crafts Fair takes place on Second Ave. & Main St. in downtown Sandpoint. Elements of the fair include artist booths & food vendors. Artwork exhibited includes sculpture, ceramics, metal, fiber, photography, paintings, mixed media, wood, crafts, and more. All proceeds go directly to support POAC's programs in visual and performing arts and art education for the benefit of our community. Check it out Saturday 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and Sunday 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. ArtInSandpoint.org/arts-crafts-fair.------------------------

title: Historic Walking Tours
description: Every Friday at 11 a.m. you can join a knowledgeable tour guide at Elevate Realty, 212 N. First Ave. for a one-hour tour of downtown Sandpoint. Though rooted in key narratives about the people and events that have shaped Sandpoint over the past 150 years, each docent adds their own favorite anecdotes to the tour, meaning no two are exactly alike! Tickets are required and can be purchased here. $15 for adults, $5 for youth

title: Sandpoint Teen Center: Bowling
description: All activities require a permission slip. Contact the activity director (Danni) at 509-319-9493 to sign up. This event takes place the second Friday of every month
contact: the activity director (Danni) at 509-319-9493 to sign up

title: Live Music with the Mike Wagoner Band
description: Mike Wagoner, Utah John, and Jaco always fill the Pend d'Oreille Winery, 301 Cedar St., so arrive early for an evening of pop, blues, and classic rock from 5-8 p.m

title: Live Music with Hot Cheetohs
description: Hit up Connie's, 323 Cedar St. for some live music starting at 5 p.m. with the Hot Cheetohs

title: Utara Open House
description: Join at the Utara Production Facility, 2617 N. Boyer Ave. from 5-8 p.m. for an all-ages, sneak preview of Utara's production facility which will soon be open to the public 5 days a week

title: Live Music with Waterhouse
description: Join from 6-8:30 p.m. at Matchwood, 513 Oak St. Waterhouse is the music of Chris Paradis. A mix of bluegrass, folk, and original music
